content.description:
Begin on

What a Nice Little Climb

. At the 3rd bolt, go right and up through thin, techy moves; and clip one more bolt to separate anchors. This is hard to read from the ground, but it is a fun puzzle.
content.location: This is the furthest rightmost climb on the main wall.

content.description: The crux after the 2nd bolt is pretty thin. I took the right bolt variation after bolt 3, and I canâ€™t speak for the left.
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts, quickdraws, and cold shut anchors.
content.location: It is the farthest route to the right, just left of the arete.

content.description:
Climb the center of the wall. Stoppers and cams, shuts.  This is a great climb and a solid 5.8 all the way up.  It is a trad route but shares anchors with "

That 5.10a

". So if you don't have gear, you can certainly top rope this climb.
content.protection: Stoppers and cams, to two shuts.
content.location:
Center of the Wall to the right of

That 5.10a

.

content.description:
Great 5.10 climbs up 5 bolts to two cold shut anchors (shared with "

This 5.8

"). Some slightly tricky moves come with a few solid holds and a small roof near the top.  It is a good climb if starting to lead 5.10 climbs, though there is a short runout between the first and second bolt.
content.location:
It is just to the right of the center

5.8 gear route

.

content.description: This route is a nerve-racking route which protrudes over the road. The rock is great, but belaying is a little sketchy, because you pretty much have to stand on the road. Watch for cars! The start is pretty tricky, and it gets tricky again once you're really up there. It is a solidly fun route.
content.location: Literally, it is right next to the road.

content.description:
Do the same start as

Hard and Bizarre

. After the first bolt, move right at the horizontal seam and then straight to the anchors. The crux is at at the 2nd bolt. After that, it's easy climbing to the anchors.
content.protection:
4 bolts and the shared two bolt anchor with

Hard and Bizarre

.
content.location:
This is right of

Hard and Bizarre

.

content.description: Two awkward mantles get you past a couple horizontal seams, and then some edging on flakes to a right-leaning crack puts you home to the anchors. This is a fun climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: It is the leftmost route on the east side of the rock.
